results.title: Hemodynamically-directed atenolol therapy is associated with a blunted rise in maternal sFLT-1 levels during pregnancy.
results.text_hl: Early treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Cardiac_Output_High</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016534 @@@high cardiac output@@@ with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ decreases the risk for @DISEASE_Pre_Eclampsia @DISEASE_MESH:D011225 @@@preeclampsia@@@.

citations.NLM: Carr DB, Tran LT, Brateng DA, Kawamura C, Shofer JB, Karumanchi SA, Easterling TR. Hemodynamically-directed atenolol therapy is associated with a blunted rise in maternal sFLT-1 levels during pregnancy. Hypertens Pregnancy. 2009 Feb;28(1):42-55. PMID: 19165669
citations.BibTeX: @article{19165669, title={Hemodynamically-directed atenolol therapy is associated with a blunted rise in maternal sFLT-1 levels during pregnancy.}, author={Carr DB and Tran LT and Brateng DA and Kawamura C and Shofer JB and Karumanchi SA and Easterling TR}, journal={Hypertens Pregnancy}, volume={28}, number={1}, pages={42-55}}

results.title: Norepinephrine-induced beta 1-adrenergic peripheral vasodilation in conscious dogs.
results.text_hl: Administration of @CHEMICAL_Phentolamine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010646 @@@phentolamine@@@ to intact @SPECIES_9615 @@@dogs@@@ caused a fall in mean arterial pressure (23 +/- 5%) and TPR (34 +/- 5.4%) and an endogenous increase in plasma NE (2,987 +/- 905 pg/ml) and @CHEMICAL_Epinephrine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004837 @@@epinephrine@@@ (584 +/- 92 pg/ml). These @<m>DISEASE_Cardiac_Output_High</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016534 @@@increases in cardiac output@@@ and decreases in TPR were also reversed by @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (0.5 mg/kg).

citations.NLM: Vatner SF, Knight DR, Hintze TH. Norepinephrine-induced beta 1-adrenergic peripheral vasodilation in conscious dogs. Am J Physiol. 1985 Jul;249(1 Pt 2):H49-56. PMID: 2861749
citations.BibTeX: @article{2861749, title={Norepinephrine-induced beta 1-adrenergic peripheral vasodilation in conscious dogs.}, author={Vatner SF and Knight DR and Hintze TH}, journal={Am J Physiol}, volume={249}, number={1 Pt 2}, pages={H49-56}}

results.title: The relationship between hemodynamics and inflammatory activation in women at risk for preeclampsia.
results.text_hl: A total of 42 @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ in the high-risk group received @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ for @<m>DISEASE_Cardiac_Output_High</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016534 @@@high cardiac output@@@.

citations.NLM: Carr DB, McDonald GB, Brateng D, Desai M, Thach CT, Easterling TR. The relationship between hemodynamics and inflammatory activation in women at risk for preeclampsia. Obstet Gynecol. 2001 Dec;98(6):1109-16. PMID: 11755562
